means: <文>吹嘘，自夸( vaunt的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: Simpson's much vaunted discoveries are in fact commonplace in modern sociology.
sentence.Network_cn: 辛普森的那些被大肆称赞的发现在现代社会学中实际上都不足为奇。

sentence.Network_en: Its vaunted security procedures hadn't worked.
sentence.Network_cn: 它那套被大肆吹嘘的安保程序并没有发挥作用。

sentence.Network_en: Their much vaunted reforms did not materialize.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们大肆吹嘘的改革并没有实现。

PerfectNetExp.abs: 英美重要报刊的热点话题词汇表 - 豆丁网 ... unconditional a. 无条件的 vaunted a. 吹嘘的，夸耀的☆ visible a. 引人注目的.
variant 变种vaunted 炫耀的velocity 速度
mitzvah n.戒律，德行vaunted a. 过分吹嘘的oodles of 许多的

list.abs: and it rolling on May 23 , when Cabrera's walk-off double earned him the vaunted championship belt and another pie to the face .火力持续在五月23日燃烧，牛奶又敲出一支再见二垒安打，为他自己赢得了一条夸张的冠军腰带，他的脸上也再一次被砸了派。
This was not a mere empty vaunt , but a deliberate avowal of his real sentiments ., 这倒不是一个空洞的吹牛 , 而是他真实感情的供状.
They vaunted into the new boy ., 她们挖苦起那个新来的男孩.
kids need a range of authentic role models -- as opposed to members of their clique , pop stars and vaunted athletes .孩子需要一系列真实的行为榜样，这与他们小圈子里的成员，流行歌星及自负的运动员不同。

entry.tran: 被吹嘘的;被过分夸耀的
entry.def: If you describe something as vaunted or much vaunted, you mean that people praise it more than it deserves.

example.ex: Its vaunted security procedures hadn't worked...
example.tran: 它那套被大肆吹嘘的安保程序并没有发挥作用。

example.ex: Simpson's much vaunted discoveries are in fact commonplace in modern sociology.
example.tran: 辛普森的那些被大肆称赞的发现在现代社会学中实际上都不足为奇。

auth_sentence.content: Even the vaunted Tyrannosaurus rex probably had a downy coat.
